Reviews.Title: “potentially good but the hotel needs a lot of works to improve”
Reviews.Author: serandreica'pisani
Reviews.Content: my partner and I spent 2 nights in this hotel recently, and even if the rate was relatively low, we actually spent quite a lot of money for what we got. the hotel looks nice from the outside, but inside the rooms really need some fixing. the first room we were given had a terrible smell when we stepped in: we realised it was the mould on the bathroom ceiling. we asked to change the room also because there was a dirty t-shirt left by some previous guests in one of the drawers. the new room was better, but only one central light, no table lights near the bed (and one bedside table) so no chance to read in bed (the central light had to be switched off only from near the entrance, so you had to get out of the bed). the bathroom was small and with some tiles to be fixed: the small window on the top of the wall difficult to open. but the worst was the breakfast room: the first morning we were eating with ants running on our table. one of the waiters needs for sure some training: he hardly speaks Italian, and he lacks the rudiments of his job. tables are put in an incredible way: when you seat you may share your table with other gustes which is not a problem, but because the space is limited you will probably have to disturb the people sitting with you to go to the buffet. as for the area, not too bed, but not so special... we will not stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: DTripper_11
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel in a quiet area. We had a couple of small problems on moving in but these were resolved quickly and without any fuss. Reception staff were very helpful but could have been a little more friendly. Don't worry about comments regarding the area. We had some good meals in some friendly local restaurants within a few minutes walk.

Reviews.Title: “I will always stay at the same hotel in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: indianbungee
Reviews.Content: We were three families traveling in Rome and also nice cities in Tuscany, Umbria, Emilio-Romagna, Lombardy regions. Villa San Lorenzo was our base camp with reasonable price. It has good location for us ( we hired a Mercedes Vito for three family). Staffs were very polite and sincere. Almost every nights we drank our own vines and smoke cigars in the garden and we were given glasses, plates what ever we needs free of charge. Receptionists were very friendly and polite too. As a result, we liked hotel, staff, price (85 Euros for a family-three persons including breakfast) and all.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean hotel in suburbs”
Reviews.Author: Fatima027
Reviews.Content: This stylish 3 star hotel was very nice.The rooms are a little small but adequate. the bathroom was clean.It is in a quiet neighbourhood - not central nor walking distance to central Rome. However there are bus and tram services close by that can take you all over and connections are good.We could get to the colleseum, vatican and a sunday market from the hotel. Even late evening buses are available but need to check the times. The breakfast was adequate and simple.There is a small lift to the upper floors but u can also walk up the steps. There is a supermarket close by but not too many restaurants that are open till late. I would recommend this hotel if u r watching your budget- resonable rates for Rome

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: DrDennyD
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Villa San Lorenzo is a hidden gem in a neighborhood that does not, at first appearance, look like a thriving area. Don't be fooled by the neighborhood - the buildings in the area are covered with graffiti, but remember graffiti is an art form that goes back to the days of the Roman Empire. The first look at the hotel from its beautifully manicured front courtyard and parking lot is one of marvel - the foliage and trees in front are very tasteful and well kept, and the hotel has a perquisite that is not often seen in Rome - Free Parking! The staff is friendly and helpful, the lobby area is sparkling with comfortable seating and marble everywhere. The breakfast room has marble floors, travertine wainscoting on the walls, and two beautiful crystal chandeliers hanging from the ceiling. The servers at breakfast are attentive, and the espresso and capoccino are excellent. The breakfast spread is typical of a Roman hotel - croissants, both plain and filled, cold cereals, cold meat and cheese slices, cereals, fruit juices, rolls, and so on. It is all fresh and very good. The guest room we stayed in was clean and comfortable, with a king sized bed, desk, and armoir, two end tables, two armchairs, a telephone, and several electrical outlets for things like camera and cell phone chargers and razors. The bathroom had a lighted medicine cabinet, bidet, toilet, sink, and a shower. The shower stall was somewhat small, but as good as can be found for the cost of the room. They had a deal were if you stay five nights, the sixth night is free. Wireless high speed internet is available for a nominal fee - 7 Euro for 48 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good”
Reviews.Author: Ahti
Reviews.Content: In the middle of a student area, with gritty urban surround sits this old villa: a haven of peace and elegance. It's a simple hotel. Rooms look and feel historic: not everyone's taste, but rather lovely. Windows have old shutters & you awake to the sounds of Rome, open sutters and observe the patio with trees and birds and bright sunlight. It's all rather lovely. Service matches the hotel: polite, courteous, even elegant: old worldly in the best way. Location is odd: feels like hotel shoudl be with its cousins back in the Aventino: but if you need to be in this part of town, it's a gem.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent price for what you get. nice hotel. good service.”
Reviews.Author: shaharuty
Reviews.Content: Good service, nice location for young people Although not near the center of Rome, has good restaurants and bars near the hotel. Nice clean room The service at reception was courteous and patient. Average breakfast, but good. Excellent price in relation to value Suitable only for those who do not care to take the bus 10-15 minutes to the center of Rome

Reviews.Title: “Decent choice for the euro-conscious traveler”
Reviews.Author: trentonmakes
Reviews.Content: It was an oppressively hot July, and only on my second day did the cleaning staff switch on a button for air-conditioning that I hadn't found--but that was my fault for not having asked. The hotel is respectable and a fair share of its clientele appears to be Europeans coming by car. The hotel is east off the railroad tracks leading into Termini station, just outside Rome's ancient walls -- not really close to any of Rome's treasures, but within reasonable walking distance (even on a blisteringly hot day!) of Porta Maggiore, the university quarter, and the priceless church of San Lorenzo. If you're relying on public transit, you'll need to connect by tram or bus to one of the principal lines or to the Metro. Still, I got a great rate for decent quarters, and when peaking into the other rooms being cleaned I think mine was by no means the best in the establishment!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, but not so great for everything else”
Reviews.Author: AmericaninRome13
Reviews.Content: This is a hike from Termini, if you have a lot of luggage take a cab and make sure they run the meter (the taxi driver tried to charge me €25 for a 3 minute cab ride). Easy to get to public transport and walk to termini if you don't have a lot to carry. I paid €45 a night, which I think is a great deal for a room in Rome. The room was clean, but the bathroom had mildew and the shower didn't drain quickly and there is no safe. Wireless was available for €7 for 48 hours but only works reliably in the lobby or first floor. Also, international phone cards don't work in the room. The flat screen TV is nice and has a lot of channels, however almost all are in Italian. My room faces the courtyard so it's very quiet, apart from other hotel-goers coming and going. I would recommend this place overall if you don't mind staying in a less than perfect hotel. I felt safe and comfortable. If you want a romantic getaway, this is not the place. However, if you plan on just using your room for sleeping and showering and spend the rest of your time experiencing Rome, this is a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Just terrible”
Reviews.Author: Oleg84
Reviews.Content: Poor location far from any attractions which you have to reach by taxi or public transport (a trip to St. Peter's takes almost one hour by tram), definitely not the safest and not the most beautiful area of Rome with a lot of graffiti. No fridge in the room which is very inconvenient during summer months especially with a view of an air conditioner which created a lot of noise but almost no cool air, water drainage from shower basin was not working properly and there was always dirty water in the shower. And hotel staff was really rude and unhelpful.

Reviews.Title: “Not for everyone but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: brzab
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night in early Sept. My first impression of the area was that it looked depressed. Lots of graffiti and tagging. Never felt unsafe, though. Walked to hotel from the Termini. The hotel was like an oasis in a desert. Well cared for and tended courtyard in front. Room was beautifully decorated. Bathroom was larger than some I've been in but showering was messy with just a hand held nozzle and a small splash partition that didn't help much. Staff was pleasant and helpful with dining recommendations. Breakfast was basic with espresso, slice meats and cheeses, pastries and rolls. Not a bad deal for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Lousy hotel”
Reviews.Author: iloveVT
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really bad. The pictures are very deceptive. They said the room had a balcony and a safe and it had neither and it was so tiny that you could barely move around. The shower was 2 feet by 2 feet and flooded when you took a bath. They could remove the bidet and enlarge the shower!! The airconditioner stopped working and when we told them, they came and meddled with it and shrugged and said that they could not do anything - this in August when Rome is unbearably hot. The staff does not smile and are rather abrupt and not at all helpful. The iron that they gave leaked water on the bed and they did not bother to even dry it! Breakfast was not good and coffee was lousy so we had to ask for tea. All in all, a lousy hotel for the value.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Good Deal”
Reviews.Author: djhcwctr
Reviews.Content: I was very reluctant to book a hotel that did not have a review on tripadvisor, but I decided to take a risk. As I walked from the Termini Station following my mapquest directions, the neighborhood seemed to be getting more and more seedy (dodgy). And, yes, when I was only one block away, I was planning on turning around, losing the money, and moving on to a different hotel. I'm glad that I did not. Though the Hotel S. Lorenzo Maria is in a bit of a rougher area than I might be accustomed to, I've actually grown quite fond of my roost for the past few days. The hotel is immaculately clean, very nicely decorated, the staff was excellent, the cleaning staff was even more friendly. The pictures on the official website aren't fake. It's really quite that nice. True, you have to take a tram or bus to get here (it's not really walkable from the Termini--and certainly not recommended as the neighborhood between here and there isn't great), I really think that this is a great deal. For a very reasonable price, I've been able to stay a ten minute tram ride from the Coliseum and the amenities are quite nice... wireless internet, cable tv, plenty of hot water, good air conditioning, breakfast, and a charming property with lots of character. If you're not comfortable with cities and a bit of grit is going to cause you alarm, this isn't the place for you. But if you're the sort of person who is comfortable with the realities of an urban setting (and can deal with taking the tram/bus), you could really like it here and save a lot of money. I really liked it here and would certainly come back. Would I come back with mom? Hmm. Mom would probably like a bit more curb appeal.

Reviews.Title: “Not as nice as some”
Reviews.Author: thefatcon
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. The reception area was very nice as was the bar, Breakfast was ok but on the second morning of our stay we were a little late getting down, I asked the small female waiter if there were more cheese and was quite roughly informed thet the german bus party had eaten it all and there was only the processed cheese left. The bedroom was a place to sleep only, the shower was a disgrace and mould all over it and lower part was a health hazzard. My wife only wore her slippers in the bedroom and the soles were filthy which showed that the marble floors had possibly been swept but definatly now mopped down. Staff on reception were very helpful but I think they all have forgotten how to smile. The hotel is no way 800 metres more like 3 kilometres from Termini. The area is very quiet but we didnt fell threatened in anyway. The Arancia Blu is a must just a 2 minute walk behind the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Will never stay again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Located in a not very plesant residential area. Did not feel unsafe but would not recommend a single female staying there and walking in the late evening. There is only tram to the metro station - ok but need some time to go to the hotel. Bathrooms are old and mine was stinky like a public toilet. It seemed that my bathroom was never cleaned during my stay. Furniture is not very cheap but is absolutely not functional and appears to be like a decoration. Personnel (especially if compaired with other hotels I stayed in Florence and Milan) seems to be very unhappy that they work in this hotel. In summary, do not expect something special. Definitely not worth paying more than 50 EUR for a single room. If you can afford paying 70-80 EUR, I recommend finding another hotel, cleaner and closer to the center.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property, peaceful neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Wine&Travel
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at Villa San Lorenzo. In the San Lorenzo district, close to Stazione Termini, it is not walking distance from the sights, but the tram stop is literally just a 2 minute walk from the hotel. Given the excellent price of the hotel, it was worth the stay. The tram will take you directly to the Coluseum, and once you figure out the transportation system, everything is just a tram, metro, or bus stop away. The rooms are small, but nice. We had a room facing a small inner courtyard which was very peaceful and delightful. Breakfast is your ordinary European breakfast, but the coffee was so good. There's an Internet cafe just around the corner with a friendly staff and cheap prices, in case you want to check in with family and friends back home. If you get a chance, for dinner dine at Arancia Blu. Excellent and a short walk away!

HotelInfo.Name: Villa San Lorenzo Maria Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Via dei Liguri 7, 00185 Rome, Italy
